left_text: Gonostylus of male about three times as long as basal width, as seen in side view; basitibial plate of female almost bare, margin fully exposed and not at all raised but curving down to level of rest of tibia; claws of female with inner tooth minute, its axis parallel to that of distal part of claw (palearctic Asia)
right_text: Gonostylus of male ﬁve or more times as long as basal width; basitibial plate of female with small, more or less appressed hairs that usually hide part of margin, which is often minutely raised; claws of female with inner tooth larger, diverging from axis of distal part of claw

left_text: Clypeus of female broadly ﬂattened, covered with short, erect, robust hairs with hooked or wavy apices (Fig. 112-14c) (oculoclypeal distance of male 0.5 to 1.0 times minimum width of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment) (Mexico, T exas))
right_text: Clypeus of female convex, with ordinary vestiture

left_text: Maxillary stipes of female with longitudinal band of coarse bristles having hooked or wavy apices; oculoclypeal distance greater than minimum width of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment (Fig. 112-6a, f) (Mexico)
right_text: Maxillary stipes without such bristles; oculoclypeal distance variable but often minute, less than one-fourth of minimum width of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment (holarctic and Africa)
